I'm giving up on this mainsteam media/corporate-led #metoo movement.  BIPOC and LGBTQ folks have been organizing against gender violence forever and maybe listing to the insights from this work could shed light on how damaging the support for #AmberHeardIsAnAbuser is for everyone
It's perfectly consistent to have a feminist analysis of gender violence and recognize that #AmberHeardIsAnAbuser  - people of all genders can be complicit in supporting patriarchal logics that punish men for failing to be "real men."
Thus while people laugh at #the defecation incident, I see it as a more frightening example of Heard communicating that there was nothing she wasn't willing to do and no place including his own bed Depp could be safe. #AmberHeardIsAnAbuser
Physical violence can be "one" way that an abuser controls another, but is certainly not the only way.  It can be engaging in behaviors that shows the person that there is no boundaries to how you will respond if the abused person doesn't comply. #AmberHeardIsAnAbuser
In addition, this movement has recognized that the person who is being abused will sometimes fight back. But fighting back does not constitute "mutual abuse." Because abuse is fundamentally about who is controlling the reality of another.  #AmberHeardIsAnAbuser
The grassroots #metoo movement that has been in the trenches for decades recognizes that abuse is about a system of behaviors designed to the alter the reality of the person being abused. It recognizes that one ways abusers abuse who is by claiming abuse. #AmberHeardIsAnAbuser
As someone who has been involved in the anti-violence movement for over 30 years, it seems the corporate-run so-called #metoo movement has never cared about gender violence based on its uncritical support of #AmberHeardIsAnAbuser It cares more to protect its marketing scheme.
